criteria.name: Example or Type
criteria.description: Correctly identifies a software example that aligns with the given category and logically fits the scenario.

scoringLevels.full: Example is fully correct and relevant to the category.
scoringLevels.partial: Example is somewhat relevant but lacks specificity.
scoringLevels.minimal: Example is mostly incorrect but has a minor relation or is completely incorrect/blank.

subCriteria.name: Accuracy
subCriteria.description: Correctly identifies a software example that aligns with the given category.

subCriteria.name: Relevance
subCriteria.description: The example logically fits the scenario and aligns with industry norms.

criteria.name: Acquisition/Sourcing Approach
criteria.description: Correctly selects 'Buy,' 'Rent,' or 'Build' based on industry norms and justifies why the approach makes sense for the software type.

scoringLevels.full: Correctly identifies and justifies the acquisition method.
scoringLevels.partial: Acquisition method is correct but lacks proper justification.
scoringLevels.minimal: Acquisition method is incorrect or missing.

subCriteria.name: Accuracy
subCriteria.description: Correctly selects 'Buy,' 'Rent,' or 'Build' based on industry norms.

subCriteria.name: Relevance
subCriteria.description: Justifies why the approach makes sense for the software type.

criteria.name: First Net Benefit
criteria.description: Identifies one way to increase net benefits that relates to one of the rubric categories (Usability, Usefulness, Social Influence) and is specific to the software type.

scoringLevels.full: Benefit is fully correct in both accuracy and relevance.
scoringLevels.partial: Benefit is somewhat relevant but not fully specific.
scoringLevels.minimal: Benefit is vague, loosely connected, or missing.

subCriteria.name: Accuracy
subCriteria.description: The benefit relates to one of the rubric categories (Usability, Usefulness, Social Influence).

subCriteria.name: Relevance
subCriteria.description: The benefit is specific to the software type.

criteria.name: Second Net Benefit
criteria.description: Identifies a second way to increase net benefits from a different category than the first benefit.

scoringLevels.full: Benefit is fully correct in both accuracy and relevance and from a different category than first benefit.
scoringLevels.partial: Benefit is somewhat relevant but not fully specific or from the same category as first benefit.
scoringLevels.minimal: Benefit is vague, loosely connected, or missing.

subCriteria.name: Accuracy
subCriteria.description: The benefit relates to one of the rubric categories (Usability, Usefulness, Social Influence) different from the first benefit.

subCriteria.name: Relevance
subCriteria.description: The benefit is specific to the software type.
